title: How to Make Hot Chocolate Mug Cake

methods.name: Making Basic Hot Chocolate Mug Cake

steps.headline: Get a large, ceramic mug.
steps.description: The mug needs to be large enough to hold at least 8 ounces (240 milliliters). If the mug is too small, the cake may overflow and create a mess. You can eat the cake straight from the mug with a spoon. If you'd rather invert it onto a plate, grease the mug with cooking spray first.

steps.headline: Add the dry ingredients into the mug.
steps.description: Measure out your flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt. Add everything into the mug.

steps.headline: Add the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Measure out your oil and milk, and pour it into the mug. If you are vegan, you can use any type of non-dairy milk you wish, such as almond, soy, or coconut.

steps.headline: Stir everything together.
steps.description: You can use a fork or mini whisk for this. Keep stirring until everything is mixed together. There should be no streaks, swirls, lumps, or clumps of flour or powder.

steps.headline: Microwave for 40 to 50 seconds.
steps.description: If you have a weaker microwave, cook the cake for 60 seconds instead. If you want the marshmallows in this recipe to be slightly toasted, sprinkle them on top of the batter before you cook it.

steps.headline: Allow the cake to cool for 5 minutes.
steps.description: Use a pot holder to take the mug out of the microwave. Set it down on a heat safe surface, and let it cool for 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Garnish the cake with mini marshmallows or a dollop of whipped cream.
steps.description: If you like to add any other toppings to hot chocolate, just as fudge sauce or peppermint sprinkles, feel free to add them. If you greased the mug earlier, invert the cake onto a plate first. Garnish it as desired.

methods.name: Making Mexican Hot Chocolate Mug Cake

steps.headline: Mix together your dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: Measure out the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, salt, and spices. Put everything into a large mixing bowl and whisk together to combine. The more cocoa powder you use, the darker your cake will be. For a twist, try brown sugar instead of white sugar. This recipe is eaten straight from the mug with a spoon. If you'd rather serve it on a plate, grease the mug with cooking spray first.

steps.headline: Add the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Measure out the milk, egg, oil, and extracts. Pour everything into the bowl. If you are vegan, you can use a different type of milk, such as almond, coconut, or soy. You can leave the egg out if you are vegan or simply wish for a lighter cake. Add 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) of espresso or strong coffee for a twist.

steps.headline: Whisk everything together.
steps.description: Keep whisking until the batter is smooth. You should not see any streaks of unbroken egg yolk or clumps of flour or cocoa powder. Be sure to scrape the bottom of the bowl often.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into a microwave-safe mug(s).
steps.description: This recipe is enough to make one big microwave cake, or two smaller ones. The mug(s) needs to be able to hold at least twice as much batter. If the mug is not big enough, the cake will overflow as it rises. Use a rubber spatula to help guide the batter into the mug(s).

steps.headline: Add a sprinkle of chocolate chips, if desired.
steps.description: You can add the chocolate chips now for extra chocolate-y goodness, or you can add them later, after you finish cooking the cake. You can also omit them altogether. For best flavor, use dark or bittersweet chocolate chips. They will help cut the sweetness of the cake. You can garnish this hot chocolate cake with mini marshmallows. If you want them to be slightly toasted, sprinkle them on top of the batter now.

steps.headline: Microwave for 60 to 90 seconds.
steps.description: Check the center of the cake by poking it with a toothpick. If the toothpick comes out with crumbs on it, cook the cake at 10-second intervals until the toothpick comes out clean. Don't overcook the cake, or it will come out too dry and crumbly.

steps.headline: Allow the cake to cool.
steps.description: Use a pot holder or an oven mitt to take the mug(s) out of the microwave. Set them down on a heat-safe surface, and let them cool for about 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Garnish it, if desired.
steps.description: Add a swirl of whipped cream on top of the mug cake. Garnish it further with a sprinkle of chocolate shavings, a shake of cocoa powder, a dusting of ground cinnamon, or a handful of sliced almonds. Consider mixing and matching flavors. Try chocolate shavings with almonds, or cocoa powder and ground cinnamon! If you greased the mug earlier, invert the cake onto a plate, then garnish it.

steps.headline: Get a large, microwave-safe mug.
steps.description: The mug needs to be able to hold at least 8 ounces (240 milliliters). If the mug is too small, the batter may overflow and make a mess in your microwave. You can eat the brownie straight from the mug with a spoon. If you'd prefer to serve it on a plate, grease the mug with cooking spray first.

steps.headline: Add the hot chocolate powder and flour into the mug.
steps.description: If you can't find any hot chocolate powder, you can use 2 tablespoons (15 grams) of unsweetened cocoa powder and 2 to 4 tablespoons (30 to 55 grams) of sugar.

steps.headline: Pour in the water, butter, and vanilla or peppermint extract.
steps.description: If you have not already, melt the butter in a small saucepan over the stove or in the microwave. Pour it into the mug along with the butter and vanilla extract. If you are vegan, you can substitute your favorite oil instead.

steps.headline: Stir everything together to combine.
steps.description: You can do this with a fork or mini whisk. Keep stirring until no clumps remain, and the mixture is smooth. Be sure to scrape the bottom of the bowl often.

steps.headline: Add a handful of marshmallows on top.
steps.description: Do not stir these in. Let them float on top of the brownie. They will melt slightly as the cake cooks, and give you a toasty, fluffy topping.

steps.headline: Heat the brownie for 60 to 90 seconds.
steps.description: Don't overcook the brownie. It will appear wet and soggy in the middle.

steps.headline: Allow the brownie to cool.
steps.description: Use a pot holder or an oven mitt to take the mug out of the microwave. Set the mug down on a heat-safe surface, and allow the brownie to cool for about 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Garnish the mug brownie, if desired.
steps.description: Add a handful of mini marshmallows on top. If you'd like, you can add other popular hot chocolate garnishes, such as whipped cream, chocolate shavings, or crushed peppermint candy. If you greased the mug with cooking spray, invert the mug onto a plate first.
